block.para: Subspace property of an eigenspace Given an (n,n)-matrix \Mtrx{A}, the eigenspace E_k of \Mtrx{A} with eigenvalue \lambda_k is a subvector space of \RNr[n]. This is so because E_k is the null space of the matrix (\Mtrx{A} - \IdMtrx[n]), hence is the orthogonal complement of the row vectors of (\Mtrx{A} - \IdMtrx[n]), and this is a subspace of \RNr[n].
